body.name: A Tent For Two : An MM Romance Novella (Melbourne Boys Novellas Book 1)
body.description: When Miles goes camping with his best friend, Beckett, there’s just one problem: Miles forgot his sleeping bag.The simple solution would be to share with Beckett, but Beckett hates skin-contact. Even the prospect of sharing a tent with Miles makes Beckett flustered and he dismisses the idea immediately. Which is fine. Miles can respect the boundaries of their friendship.But their camping trip turns out to be full of surprises. Beckett’s been hiding a few secrets from Miles, one of which is that he doesn’t always hate skin-contact, not in certain situations, not with certain people. But the biggest surprise of all will come when Miles realises just how he feels about his best friend Beckett.A Tent for Two is a 27,000 word MM new adult romance novella featuring the friends-to-lovers trope.Note: contains explicit tent sex & an extremely oblivious main character. Read more

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #10,849 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #221 in Gay Romance #301 in LGBTQ+ Romance (Books) #1,146 in New Adult & College Romance (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Obliviousness at its finest
reviews.reviewText: I could relate to Miles in this story so well. Not knowing someone, let alone your best friend, is in love with you…while all the same time not quite understanding what you yourself are feeling. Spice level 🌶🌶🌶 and well worth a read. I finished it in 1 day. At my sons soccer practice while keeping a straight face and not blushing ☺️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A Great Novella
reviews.reviewText: I loved this novella, I just wish I could find the stories for the other roommates! You can’t dangle the dream and then not make said dream happen! But really though, take a couple hours and give this a read, you won’t be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Oh Sweet Oblivious Miles
reviews.reviewText: Miles has all of these thoughts and fantasies about his best friend but never really analyzed any of it. Sharing a tent with his best friend changes everything. This is a quick and sweet read where you get to see Miles figure it out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 11, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Miles must be the most completely clueless person in the world. Even the reader could figure it out about his friends and Beckett. But despite the cluelessness Miles is adorable and Beckett is great. Awesome story can’t wait for the next installments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: For a short story I highly enjoyed it. Very cute and fun with the oblivious nature. Totally recommend for a short and sweet story

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not sure why people gave this 4 stars
reviews.reviewText: This was pretty bad. All from Miles' third point of view, which is super annoying. The writer made Miles look stupid and flaky. It wasn't put together well at all

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a really cute short story. Miles was a tad too oblivious but I still enjoyed it. I hope we can see more of them in the future.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I appreciate this was a Novella but it just didn’t really feel all that fleshed out. It felt like the author had an idea for a scene and then just sort of stretched that idea into 8 or so chapters and called it done. For me a Novella should still have all the things a full length book has just obviously on a much small scale, things happen a lot quicker as well because of this.I just can’t say I really enjoyed it and I won’t remember anything about it in a few hours.Also I’m pretty sure Australians call flip flops thongs? I think if you’re going to set a book in a country you should use the language they would use…. I don’t know it felt Americanised. Not one for me, fortunately it only took a couple of hours to read.
Very sweet and cute, I especially enjoyed the second part. I never get bored of best friends to lovers and this was perfect especially if you are amused by an extremely oblivious mc. Cute and sexy.

This is an 'oblivious about feelings including own' sort of trope and since it's been done so many times I wasn't expecting much. Especially from a novella. Well clearly, I was wrong. This was excellent excellent excellent. The characters are fully fleshed out despite the limited space for description and we even grow invested in side characters we NEVER MEET. That's how great the writing is! Definitely going to read more from this author, I reckon we've found ourselves another one click buy. 5 stars :)
This was a sweet quick read that I couldn't put down. I always love a book set in my home country too. This was great and I hope the others have books I'm off to find out.
This novella is about two best friends who end up having to share a tent while camping. The build-up and tension was great and I loved the steamy scenes!
